article.headline: Hofstra 58, Columbia 55
article.story: NEW YORK (AP) -- Freshman Carlos Rivera hit a 3-pointer as time expired Saturday to give Hofstra a 58-55 victory over Columbia. The 3-pointer was Rivera's only one in seven attempts. He finished with seven points on 3-for-10 shooting. Kenny Adeleke and Loren Stokes each had 12 points for the Pride (3-3), who trailed by six points with 3:34 left. Matt Preston had 18 points for the Lions (1-3), who turned the ball over with 4 seconds to play to set up the game-winning shot. Rivera took a pass inside halfcourt, took three dribbles down the left sideline and got the shot off well before the buzzer. Columbia, playing its first home game under coach Joe Jones, led 51-44 with 5:38 remaining. Gibran Washington and Wendell Gibson keyed Hofstra's 9-2 run that tied the score. Gibson finished with nine points and eight rebounds Columbia scored the game's first six points and led 11-2 before the Pride, coming off a victory at St. John's on Tuesday, came back to take a 30-25 halftime lead. The Lions were 21-for-41 from the field, while Hofstra was 21-for-56 and both struggled from 3-point range as the Pride were 2-for-13 and Columbia was 4-for-15.
